CMDQ - Command Queue Functionality
mcu » apollo330P

Detailed Description

Purpose: This module provides support functions for command queue (CMDQ) operations on Apollo5 devices. It supports command queue initialization, block allocation, status monitoring, and error handling for efficient hardware command sequencing.

Key Features

  1. Command Queue: Hardware command queue management and sequencing.
  2. Block Allocation: Dynamic block allocation and release.
  3. Status Monitoring: Real-time command queue status tracking.
  4. Error Handling: Robust error detection and recovery.
  5. Multi-Module: Support for multiple hardware modules (IOM, MSPI, BLEIF).

Functionality

  • Initialize and configure command queue
  • Allocate and release command queue blocks
  • Monitor command queue status and indices
  • Handle command queue errors and recovery
  • Support multi-module command queue operations

Usage

  1. Initialize CMDQ using am_hal_cmdq_init()
  2. Allocate blocks with am_hal_cmdq_alloc_block()
  3. Post and release blocks as needed
  4. Monitor status and handle errors
  5. Terminate or reset command queue as required

Configuration

  • Block Size: Configure command queue block sizes
  • Module Selection: Set up for IOM, MSPI, or BLEIF modules
  • Error Handling: Configure error detection and recovery
  • Status Monitoring: Set up status tracking parameters

Macros

#define AM_HAL_MAGIC_CMDQ   0xCDCDCD
 
#define AM_HAL_CMDQ_CHK_HANDLE(h)   ((h) && ((am_hal_handle_prefix_t *)(h))->s.bInit && (((am_hal_handle_prefix_t *)(h))->s.magic == AM_HAL_MAGIC_CMDQ))
 
#define AM_HAL_CMDQ_HW_IDX_MAX   (IOM0_CQCURIDX_CQCURIDX_Msk >> IOM0_CQCURIDX_CQCURIDX_Pos)
 
#define AM_HAL_CMDQ_ENABLE_CQ(cfgReg)   {AM_REGVAL((cfgReg)) |= _VAL2FLD(IOM0_CQCFG_CQEN, IOM0_CQCFG_CQEN_EN); }
 
#define AM_HAL_CMDQ_DISABLE_CQ(cfgReg)   {AM_REGVAL((cfgReg)) &= ~_VAL2FLD(IOM0_CQCFG_CQEN, IOM0_CQCFG_CQEN_EN); }
 
#define AM_HAL_CMDQ_INIT_CQCFG(cfgReg, pri, enable)   {AM_REGVAL((cfgReg)) = _VAL2FLD(IOM0_CQCFG_CQPRI, (pri)) | _VAL2FLD(IOM0_CQCFG_CQEN, (enable)); }
 
#define AM_HAL_CMDQ_ENABLE_CQUPD_INT   0x1

Function Documentation

◆ am_hal_cmdq_alloc_block()

uint32_t am_hal_cmdq_alloc_block ( void * pHandle,
uint32_t numCmd,
am_hal_cmdq_entry_t ** ppBlock,
uint32_t * pIdx )

Allocate a block of commands for posting to a command queue.

Allocates a contiguous block of command queue entries from the available space in command queue

Parameters
pHandlehandle for the command queue
numCmdSize of the command block (each block being 8 bytes)
ppBlock- Return parameter - Pointer to contiguous block of commands, which can be posted
pIdx- Return parameter - monotonically increasing transaction index

This function will take care of determining that enough space is available to create the desired block. It also takes care of necessary wrap-around

Returns
Returns 0 on success

◆ am_hal_cmdq_pause()

uint32_t am_hal_cmdq_pause ( void * pHandle,
uint32_t * pSETCLRAddr,
uint32_t ui32CQPauseSETCLR,
uint32_t ui32CQUnpauseSETCLR,
uint32_t ui32usMaxDelay )

Pause the CQ after finishing the current transaction. The CQ is in paused state after this function returns, at the beginning of next transaction.

Parameters
pHandlehandle for the command queue
pSETCLRAddrPoints to the SETCLR register for the module
ui32CQPauseSETCLRValue to be written to Pause the CQ
ui32CQUnpauseSETCLRValue to be written to unpause the CQ
ui32usMaxDelayMax time to wait (in uS)
Returns
Returns 0 on success

uint32_t am_hal_cmdq_post_block ( void * pHandle,
bool bInt )

Post the last block allocated.

Post the contiguous block of command queue entries previously allocated

Parameters
pHandlehandle for the command queue
bIntWhether the UPD interrupt is desired once the block is processed
Returns
Returns 0 on success

◆ am_hal_cmdq_release_block()

uint32_t am_hal_cmdq_release_block ( void * pHandle)

Release a block of commands previously allocated.

Releases the contiguous block of command queue entries previously allocated without posting

Parameters
pHandlehandle for the command queue

This function will internally handles the curIdx/endIdx manipulation. It also takes care of necessary wrap-around

Returns
Returns 0 on success

◆ am_hal_cmdq_reset()

uint32_t am_hal_cmdq_reset ( void * pHandle)

Reset the Command Queue.

Reset the Command Queue & associated data structures This will force the CQ reset Caller needs to ensure CQ is in steady state before this is done This also disables the CQ

Parameters
pHandlehandle for the command queue
Returns
Returns 0 on success
